title: The Impoverished Publicness of Algorithmic Decision Making
research_description: This article explores the limitations of algorithmic decision-making, particularly machine learning models, in public administration, highlighting how these models compromise the 'publicness' of decisions in democratic settings.
research_results: The use of machine learning in public decision-making leads to an impoverished publicness, reducing the capacity for dialogical and synergetic interactions in public administration.
future_research: Future research should focus on regulatory frameworks that can address the democratic deficits caused by machine learning models in public administration.
